title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: The house stands within the close, on the west side. On the first floor a small niche appears, at the right side of the doorway, immediately on entering, and in the opposite wall there is another of large size, and a highly ornamental character,— though now dilapidated, and greatly obscured with white wash,—through which a window has been broken, looking into Barringer's Close. Alongside of the latter niche a narrow turnpike stair has formerly afforded access to the floor above, and the general construction of the apartment, renders it exceedingly probable that it may have been used as a private chapel before the Reformation.
